meanings.definition: Misprograms (verb): to incorrectly set or input instructions into a computer system
meanings.sent1: She misprograms the software, causing it to crash frequently.
meanings.sent2: He always misprograms the code, leading to system malfunctions.
meanings.sent3: The computer misprograms itself and starts speaking gibberish.
meanings.sent4: His mind misprograms reality, creating a world of illusions.
meanings.sent5: The virus misprograms the system, turning it against its users.

meanings.definition: Misprograms (noun): errors or mistakes in programming code
meanings.sent1: The misprograms in the code caused the application to freeze.
meanings.sent2: Developers need to fix misprograms to ensure smooth operation.
meanings.sent3: The misprograms in the code made the robot dance uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: The misprograms in the system were like hidden traps waiting to be triggered.
meanings.sent5: Finding and correcting misprograms is crucial for software stability.

meanings.definition: Misprograms (adjective): describing something that has been incorrectly programmed
meanings.sent1: The misprograms device displayed random numbers on the screen.
meanings.sent2: The misprograms software caused data loss for many users.
meanings.sent3: The misprograms robot kept bumping into walls, amusing the onlookers.
meanings.sent4: His misprograms mind led him to believe in impossible things.
meanings.sent5: The misprograms system was a ticking time bomb waiting to explode.
